Taking notes in parallel with the session is the most efficient method: My first advice would be to start as soon as possible to draft the skeleton of your report (headlines, interesting ideas, links, references, pictures, etc). Secondly, you’ll better follow the presentation of the speaker and and take notes in parallel Usually, the conference will publish the slides, or even videos, of the different talks. Hence, when preparing your report, insist on what is not found in the slides or videos: your opinion, your advice, why you thought the talk was interesting or innovative. Sometimes, the subject of the talk is totally new to you and your biggest concern is to understand/discover a new concept. It becomes more difficult to take notes during the session, but at least write down the headlines and take a picture of the important slides (schemas, architecture, tables, etc). At the end of each day, take few minutes to go back to these slides and add a summary of each session to your report It is advisable to not cumulate notes of several days with the intention to write a report later. You’ll make your task even harder.

question: What are some potential business opportunities or collaborations being explored by Saint-Gobain based on the discussed interactions?
answer: Saint-Gobain is considering several potential business opportunities and collaborations based on the interactions from the previous week. These include Dendris' need for AI on multiplex PCR tests, Experimental's similar problem to Crocos regarding the management of bipolar disorders, BlueManda's potential need for regie, and QISTA's request for a large-scale quotation for a project involving the recommendation of the placement of anti-mosquito borne based on satellite images. Additionally, the GPMM is facing difficulties in the internal scoping of Flow Pass, and is proposing a collaboration with Geutebruck for its development. Lastly, there is a focus on a project called N-Allo for SMARTDTV.

However, please be advised that the Data Protection Law provides for both civil and criminal sanctions regarding the processing or the transfer of human resource data outside Tunisia, without obtaining prior authorisation from the INPDP. Articles 86 to 105 of the Data Protection Law provide for both criminal and civil sanctions. A penalty of one-year imprisonment and a fine of TND 5,000 (approx. €1,500) may be enforced against any employer who intentionally processes personal data without the submitting the prior notification required by the INPDP. The Data Protection Law states that a penalty of two years imprisonment and a fine of TND 10,000 (approx. €3,000) may be enforced against any employer who processes sensitive personal data without prior authorisation from the INPDP. The Data Protection Law adds that a penalty of one year imprisonment and a fine of TND 10,000 (approx. €3,000) may be enforced against any employer who uses fraud, violence or threats to gain consent from a person for the processing of their personal data. Moreover, a penalty of one-year imprisonment and a fine of TND 5,000 (approx. €1,500) are applicable to the data controller and the sub-contractor who continue the processing of personal data despite the objection of the data subject. Création d'agrégats et de nouvelles mesures Afin de construire des profils de clients et de groupes de clients connectés, un ensemble de nouvelles mesures sera à considérer. Il serait intéressant de considérer, entre autres (ces listes ne sont pas exhaustives): Point de vue du client: Le nombre de recharges par an par client Le nombre de numéros différents rechargé par un client sur différents intervalles de temps (par mois, par année) Le montant total rechargé par an par client Le nombre de canaux utilisés Point de vue du numéro rechargé: Nombre de clients qui ont rechargé le même numéro sur une année Nombre de recharges pour un numéro donné sur différents intervalles de temps (par mois, par année) Le montant total rechargé pour un numéro donné La pertinence de ces mesures pour expliquer la croissance sera évaluée et les agrégats retenus pourront venir enrichir un ou plusieurs tableaux de bord et seront également utiles à l’analyse des liens entre les clients (Phase d’analyse explicative). Une rapide exploration de données a été effectuée sur les données Mali entre 2017 et 2019, essentiellement sur les canaux IVR.

Mattermost We will answer your questions (and remember there is no dumb question!) on the following channels cop Cloud Native Engineering Dev Channel Passer la navigation Rechercher dans Euranovactrl + K Communautés Pages Personnes 14Notifications Plus Favori Groupe de pages Home 🏠 Values and Culture Communities of Practice ↗️ Employee Handbook ↗️ Consultancy Guildelines ↗️ Getting Started with Happeo Plus Employee Handbook ↗️ Consultancy Guildelines ↗️ Getting Started with Happeo Passer le contenu Welcome, Yanis Labeyrie Passer le contenu Useful links Mattermost Boond manager Gitlab SD Worx Send feedback/request about Happeo Knowledge Attic Leato (Self service online training courses) Send us feedback from the field Passer le contenu My News Company-wide newsSearch AI beta is here! 🤠Surfing on the LLM trend, Happeo launched their own search AI, and, as you can guess, we were curious and accepted to be beta testers 🤓 How It Works? Ask questions in the search bar (such as: "what is the guest wifi password"), and the algorithm will pull multiple sources within Happeo to provide you with an answer. By default, Happeo will search through the internal sources, but you can also choose to search through the integrations by clicking “Search from integrations” Where do you come in? If you are an LLM passionate, curious to test it, or just in need of a guest wifi password, shoot all your questions to the model :) From what I already tried, it needs a bit of tuning (where would be the fun otherwise), so if you feel the answer provided by Search AI was incorrect or incomplete, please click on the thumbs-up/down button next to the search result and let them know.

Attribution: Analyses the impact of the input’s perturbation on the model. • Input: the model f : RD → [0, 1]C , modified data x′ ∈ RD, model’s output y = f(x) ∈ [0, 1]C , mask M ∈ [0, 1]D used to generate x′ • Output: attribution score aM ∈ R associated to M • Description: Computes model’s response to the modified data y′ = f(x′) ∈ [0, 1]C and the predicted class index on original data Ipred = argmax I yI. The attribution score associated to M is calculated as follows: aM = A(y′Ipred), where y′Ipredis the value of y′ at the predicted class index Ipred and the attribution function is A : [0, 1] → R. 4.

to opt for vertical lists rather than horizontal ones. Vertical lists can be split into bullet-point lists, lists starting with a letter, and numbered lists. Bullet-point lists can be laid out in a variety of shapes, such as circular, square, diamond, hyphen, or arrow. Use similar types of lists consistently in similar text in the same document.For example, if you have two areas of text that present steps for doing a task, both should use the same list format—in this case, numbered lists. Numbered lists help readers follow a sequence Use numbered lists for items that are in a required order (such as step-by-step instructions) or for items that must be referred to by item number. Use bulleted lists for items that are in no required order. In the area of vertical lists, a question that often comes up is: Should you put a comma or a full stop or nothing at the end of each line and should you capitalise the first word of the line? Well, the answer depends on the nature of your list; there are two main types of bullet-point lists.

Ouvrir la publication I’ve always seen humour as a superpower. Making fun of a lousy situation, sharing a good joke, connecting with people by making them laugh… For a long time, I have been considering these means as powerful social skills. Yet, lately, I witnessed inside Euranova hard feelings after jokes were made or people hurt by some kind of “humour”. And I wondered: what is humour, after all? when should we not make humor? should a company regulate the notion of humour? Because I want to keep a fantastic asset in our culture, while keeping everyone safe with their feelings.

It can be explicit or implicit. The more logical your entire text is and the more coded your entire text is, the less explicit connectors you will need. In other words, if, from the onset, you make your logical key explicit, the less explicit connectors you will need. Say you introduce your text with: “I will now list the various ranks of the US Navy by degree of seniority”, you will not need to start each paragraph with something like “Let’s start with the most senior…” Now let’s move on to the next title in terms of seniority”, and so on. In reverse, the more complex, unusual, and elaborate your line of development is, the more explicit connectors you will need.

Vendre la DG comme réduction du time to market n'est pas top : Tu ne vends pas de valeur mais la réduction de coûts + cette réduction peut se traduire par se séparer du personnel non nécessaire. C'est bien dans une optique réduction de coût mais moins bien dans une optique création de valeur. La DG est un enabler/catalyseur (facilitateur) de valeur : Les business cases qui drivent la valeur utilisent des données, par définition, peu ou pas accessibles. La DG permet d'alimenter plus efficacement les business case, nous donne la clé pour déverrouiller l'usage des données en accord avec les législations qui réglementent leurs usages, nous permet de lier la valeur générée par un biz case aux données (tout le narratif autour de data value management) Pas besoin de convaincre que ça marche, c'est une nécessité à la transformation digitale et l'exploitation de la donnée dans une chaîne de valeur ! 3 axes stratégiques Revenu : augmenter la productivité Cost : optimiser les procédés internes, réduire la maintenance Innovation : s’engager sur des nouveaux marchés La DG est un catalyseur pour la création de valeur. Cette dernière est alors pilotée par les données !

Remarque: Cette méthodologie pourra être adaptée à la spécificité de XXX et nous préconisons également d’étudier la possibilité d’intégrer une méthodologie de projet Agile. Pour cela, il pourrait être intéressant de voir ce qui est mis en place du côté de la société partenaire. Ainsi, il serait bien d'unifier les méthodologies de gestion de projet entre les équipes IT, DevOps et Data Science. Se former à la data science De nos jours, de nombreuses plateformes de formations en distanciel proposent du contenu de qualité concernant la data science, depuis une overview jusqu’à la réalisation d’un projet en R ou en Python. Voici une sélection de supports préconisés, cette liste n’étant pas exhaustive et le besoin sera à préciser par les collaborateurs de XXX souhaitant monter en compétence: https://www.coursera.org/search?query=data%20science& https://www.coursera.org/specializations/deep-learning https://openclassrooms.com/fr/courses/4262331-demarrez-votre-projet-avec-python https://openclassrooms.com/fr/courses/4452741-decouvrez-les-librairies-python-pour-la-data-science Par ailleurs, la documentation des librairies de data science open source sont également très souvent didactiques et renvoient parfois à des papiers scientifiques ou sont relayées par des articles de blogs spécialisés, fournissant une base de connaissances riche. Langage et librairies préconisés Comme évoqué avec ... lors de l’atelier du 21 mai nous préconisons d’utiliser Python 3 comme langage de programmation privilégié à l’activité data science. Open Source, la communauté est très active dans le développement et l’amélioration de librairies, et nombre de contributions scientifiques dans le Machine Learning proposent ensuite du code en Python. Un IDE tel que Pycharm ou Visual Studio Code peut être utilisé pour coder en Python. Librairies Python et outils à utiliser: quelques références non exhaustives Import de données depuis InfluxDB: https://www.influxdata.com/blog/getting-started-python-influxdb/ Pandas, librairie d’analyse et de manipulation de données: https://pandas.pydata.org/ Numpy https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/signal.html Qualité des données avec pandas profiling: https://pandas-profiling.github.io/pandas-profiling/docs/master/rtd/# Machine learning: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/ Machine learning: https://pycaret.org/ Traitement du signal: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/signal.html Les librairies sont nombreuses, mais pas de panique, leur usage se précisera à mesure que les cas d’usage seront précisés et implémentés! Installation de Veracrypt: Pour installer Veracrypt sur votre ordinateur, il suffit de lancer les deux commandes suivantes dans votre terminal: sudo wget https://launchpad.net/veracrypt/trunk/1.24-update7/+download/veracrypt-1.24-Update7-Ubuntu-20.04-amd64.deb sudo apt-get install ./veracrypt-1.24-Update7-Ubuntu-20.04-amd64.deb Source: https://linuxhint.com/how-to-install-and-use-veracrypt-on-ubuntu/ Décryptage du disque dur avec Veracrypt: List all available partitions with: sudo blkid Locate the partition that you wish to mount. Something like "/dev/sda1" Open Veracrypt GUI Choose a slot for mounting (slot 1 is selected here) Provide the path to the encrypted volume in the "Volume" field Click "Mount" Provide the password You get something like: You can now access the hard drive directly from your filesystem: open your filesystem, go to “Other locations”. You should see your hard drive (“1,2 TB Volume” here) Before unplugin your hard drive, Unmount it with the Dismount button: Source: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/569415/encrypted-external-hard-disk-not-recognized Copie directe des fichiers du disque dur sur mnémosyne il faut préalablement être administrateur mnémosyne pour pouvoir se connecter à mnémosyne en ssh se brancher en filaire aux bureaux pour une copie plus rapide lancer la commande suivant: scp -rC <path to the mount directory of veracrypte> username@host:<path to the directory on mnemosyne> Exemple avec le user elsa qui veut copier le fichier mounté dans veracrypt1 dans le dossier AI4PET: scp -rC /media/veracrypt1/ elsa@10.0.13.102:/volume1/Data/AI4PET Docker Installation Tutoriel Elsa Schalck Docker installation Procedure 2 1) Prerequisites 2 2) Verify if docker is already installed and check docker version 2 3) Uninstall old versions if needed 2 4) Set up the repository to install docker using the repository 2 5) Tests & Verification 3 Docker-compose installation 3 1) Prerequisite 3 2) Installation Procedure 3 3) Tests & Verification 4 Addition of the user to the docker group 4 1) Prerequisite 4 2) Installation Procedure 4 3) Tests & Verification 4 Docker installation Procedure Prerequisites sudo rights Internet connexion Verify if docker is already installed and check docker version The required version for docker is: >= 20.10.16. Ask questions in the search bar (such as: "what is the guest wifi password"), and the algorithm will pull multiple sources within Happeo to provide you with an answer. By default, Happeo will search through the internal sources, but you can also choose to search through the integrations by clicking “Search from integrations” Where do you come in? If you are an LLM passionate, curious to test it, or just in need of a guest wifi password, shoot all your questions to the model :) From what I already tried, it needs a bit of tuning (where would be the fun otherwise), so if you feel the answer provided by Search AI was incorrect or incomplete, please click on the thumbs-up/down button next to the search result and let them know.

The student is recorded and assessed later, unlike the IELTS which places the candidate in front of an examiner. It exists in different forms : PBT: Paper-based test IBT: Internet-based test iBT: Scores range from 0 to 120. A score of 79 / 90 is required to pass PBT: final scores range from 310 to 677 and does not include written exam score. Since the ETS introduced the TOEFL Internet-based Test in 2005, it has progressively replaced the paper-based Test (PBT) and the computer-based test (CBT). The CBT was discontinued in September 2006 whereas it is still possible to pass paper-based tests in limited areas. Minimum scores for admission in colleges and universities Each university or college sets a minimum score for admission into the school or into a program. It is not possible to state a minimum score here as each establishment is free to set a different minimum accepted score. To illustrate this, minimum scores for admission can range as low as 61. On the other hand, a university like Oxford requires a score as high as 111 out of 120 for admission. The TOEIC is the second standardised test here is managed by the US-based ETS. They have been administering it since its creation in 1979 by a Japanese team backed by the Japanese Ministry of Economy.

question: What is DAVid and how can it benefit companies?
answer: DAVid is a solution for companies that struggle with data management. It can help address issues such as difficulty in finding data, lengthy processes for data access, high costs of data transformation, lack of reporting on data usage, and more. DAVid can solve these problems and provide companies with a more efficient and effective way to manage their data.

Un des point fondamental de la topologie est la généralisation de la notion de distance entre deux éléments d’un ensemble avec les espaces vectoriel normés et les espaces métrique ceci permet de structurer un certain nombre d’ensemble et ainsi de pouvoir généraliser la notion de continuité, de limite etc... La topologie est utilisée de manière plus ou moins directe dans un certain nombre de domaine mais les aspects les plus théoriques de la topologie avec les espaces topologiques n’ont que peut d’application. la Topologie algébrique : est un mélange des deux notion en mettant des raisonnement d’algèbre dans un cadre topologique, on y développe les notions de groupe d’homologie et de cohomologie. La topologie algébrique une branche qui est a priori très peu utilisée de manière appliquée c’est donc une grande surprise de voir qu’en machine learning ce domaine possède quelques applications. So, here is either your first dose or your booster shot of this vital information to keep applying relentlessly until your last keyboard stroke: A sentence is a set of words that is complete in itself, typically containing a subject and predicate, conveying a statement, question, exclamation, or command, and consisting of a main clause and sometimes one or more subordinate clauses. To put it in plain English, it is an idea, a meaningful unit of thought, expressed with words that interact with each other on the basis of a main verb (the predicate). It starts with a capital letter and ends with a full stop or a question mark or an exclamation mark. Once you have your subject (preferably the same subject for your entire paragraph) and your predicate, you can play around with all the other bits to make your sentence interesting, provided you respect syntactic rules. To put it in a formula, a sentence is made of S + V+ O.

question: How does one connect to the Euranova Wi-Fi using a device that requires additional steps?
answer: To connect to the Euranova Wi-Fi on a device that requires additional steps, select the Euranova Wi-Fi, then choose PEAP for Authentication. Leave the 'Anonymous identity' and 'Domain' fields empty, check the box 'No CA certificate is required'. Input your EuraNova username (the part before the @ in your EuraNova email address) and your Jumpcloud password. Before entering the password, click on the small icon on the right edge of the input and select 'save information just for me'. You will be prompted to enter your password two times.

L’employeur est tenu de prendre les mesures nécessaires pour assurer la sécurité et protéger la santé des travailleurs. Il doit tenir compte des conditions d’exposition des travailleurs à la chaleur selon leurs différents postes de travail lors de l’évaluation des risques transcrite dans le document unique, et mettre en place les mesures de prévention appropriées, intégrées au plan d’actions de prévention. Il a l’obligation de tenir compte de l’évolution des conditions climatiques et d’adapter les mesures de prévention en conséquence. Il doit donc être attentif aux informations données quotidiennement par les autorités pendant la période de vigilance (passage des différents niveaux de vigilance).En phase de vigilance canicule rouge, l’employeur doit également procéder à une réévaluation quotidienne des risques encourus par chacun des salariés et décider de l’arrêt du travail si nécessaire, notamment pour les travaux accomplis à une température très élevée et comportant une charge physique importante. Pour toute information complémentaire, l’employeur peut contacter la direction régionale de l’économie, de l’emploi, du travail et des solidarités (Dreets) et l’inspection du travail.

Le flux des données peut être automatisé pour libérer du temps à l’analyste et aux ingénieurs pour se focaliser sur leur métier. Aussi, seuls les exports de données manuels servent à la sauvegarde des données. Si une box tombe en panne, les données qui y sont stockées et non exportées sont perdues. Suivi du processus: Par ailleurs, les box sont considérées comme des serveurs qui hébergent une application web, une base de données, et effectuent des transformations. Cette décentralisation, qui a des avantages par ailleurs, complique le monitoring, la maintenance, et le déploiement de nouveaux services. Nous proposons la mise en place d’une stack de data science simplifiée dans la section Data Plateforme. Pratiques de code et rituels L’ensemble des traitements de donnée sont réalisés à partir des outils standards du domaine: Un premier traitement est réalisé en Python avant de stocker les données dans un BDD Concernant l’analyse des données et la production des rapports mensuels au format html, le travail est fait en R sous l’IDE RStudio. Le code est proprement structuré grâce à Rmarkdown . Les rapports sont générés en Dash. … travaille en local sur un ordinateur et étant seule sur la partie analyse de données, il n’y a pas de méthodologie de gestion de projet particulière mise en place. Plusieurs points durs et opportunités d’amélioration ont été identifiés: Versionning du code et des données: le travail n’existe aujourd’hui que sur la machine de développement utilisée par .... Le code n’est pas versionné et il n’existe pas, à ce jour, de backup des données récupérées au fur et à mesure sur l’IHM. Il s’agit ici d’une vulnérabilité non négligeable et pour laquelle nous proposons de mettre en place des outils et bonnes pratiques que nous détaillons dans la section Cycle de vie d’un projet software. Langage de programmation: dans la perspective de monter en puissance sur la partie data, nous ne pouvons qu’encourager XXX à continuer de travailler avec les langages de programmation choisis, open source et largement utilisés dans la communauté industrielle et scientifique dont les activités sont orientées vers l’analyse de données. Ce point est plus largement détaillé dans la section Langage et librairies préconisés. En particulier, à des fins d’automatisation des processus d’analyse des données, nous préconisons de basculer complètement sur Python. Intégration de la méthodologie DS à la gestion de projet XXX. Pour cela nous proposons de s’inspirer de la méthodologie CRISP-DM décrite dans la section Les grandes étapes d’un projet de data science. Formations en Machine Learning et à l’ingénierie de la donnée: pour les collaborateurs de la société et plus particulièrement pour ..., nous suggérons de suivre des formations pour monter en compétences sur les aspects de date engineering et de data science. Pour cela nous préconisons un ensemble de ressources disponibles en ligne dans la section Se former à la data science.

Computing the average value of each sub principle according to the following formula: Equation 1: Sub-principles computation With SP= score of a sub principle, N= number of questions under each sub principle, and Si= the score of a specific question, 0 ≤Si ≤3. 3. Computing the average value of a core principle according to the following formula: Equation 2: Core-principles computation With CP= score of a core principle, K= number of sub-principles under a given core principle, and SPi the score of a given sub-principle. We have modeled this scoring system through a bottom-up approach, whereby each answer of the questions is assigned to a corresponding score based on its answer. This latter required an examination of the possible answer to each question. The figure below provides an easy demonstration of the scoring methodology: Figure 4: Illustration of the scoring methodology RAI Maturity Determination Scoring of principles also range between 0 and 3. Each score in this range close to 5 indicates a complete fulfillment of a particular principle. A close to 0 score indicates the absence or the low presence of the application of a principle. Therefore, we suggest using the 0 to 5 range.

question: When can checks be applied during the data mining process?
answer: Checks can be applied at various steps of the RAI process, including the initial assessment check, project improvement check, and feature engineering check. Additionally, checks can be applied during the Business Understanding, Data Understanding, Data Preparation, Deployment, and Evaluation stages of the CRoss Industry Standard Process for Data Mining (CRISP-DM).

For each sample, this score should be equivalent to the probability that the model is right. When it is the case, scores can be seen as probabilities and the Confidence-ECE is equal to zero. When it is not, the Confidence-ECE indicates how far off we are from true probabilities, with a value between 0 (perfect uncertainty estimates) and 1. Confidence-MCE The Confidence-MCE is similar to the ECE, with the difference that it is equal to the error the model makes in the worst case scenario. Confidence reliability diagram The reliability diagram is a standard plot which allows the visualisation of how much probability estimates are reliable depending on the value of the estimates themselves. To build it, unseen samples are grouped together by similar score for the predicted class, and in each group, we estimate the average of these scores, and compute the fraction of correct predictions. If scores are reliable probability estimates, in each group these two values should be equal, and the corresponding point should fall on the diagonal of the diagram.

Accompagnement IA Présentation 2021 QUI SOMMES NOUS? Eura Nova: Explore, Craft and Serve Chez Eura Nova, nous sommes spécialisés en architecture de données, en intelligence artificielle et en édition logicielle. Créée en Belgique en 2008, nos équipes sont actives dans les trois domaines complémentaires que sont: les services aux entreprises, la recherche et l’incubation technologique. Notre mission: Explore, Craft and Serve. Explore: nous combinons l’ADN et les avancées technologiques d’un centre de recherche privé qui crée de la connaissance et participe à la recherche internationale Craft: nous disposons d’un incubateur de produits technologiques qui permet de rassembler habilement les difficultés du marché, découvertes auprès des clients, avec les avancées technologiques offertes par le centre de recherche. Serve: nous tirons profit de la connaissance du terrain d’un cabinet de conseil technologique dédié à la transformation numérique des entreprises avec les avancées technologiques offertes par le centre de recherche. Eura Nova Marseille a été fondée en 2017 et est une filiale détenue à 100% par la société belge dont nous reprenons les valeurs et les missions. ‹#› Une organisation tournée vers l’innovation CHAMPS D’EXPERTISE NOS SERVICES SERVICE Défis de nos clients HISTORIQUE 12 ans d’expérience 135 experts 4 produits open source 1 solution commercialisée Plus de 100 cas d’usage dans le domaine public: média, maritime, transport le secteur privé: logistique, santé, télécom, énergie, aviation, banque, marketing 2.2 M€ d’investissement par an au niveau du groupe (BE, FR, TN) INTELLIGENCE ARTIFICIELLE Nous créons des modèles de data science pour créer de la valeur à partir des données Nous organisons les flux de données et construisons des infrastructures centrées autour des données Nous développons des logiciels ergonomique et faciles à utiliser SOLUTIONS incubateur CLIENTS ARCHITECTURE DE DONNÉES INGÉNIERIE LOGICIELLE Découvertes scientifiques CENTRE R&D RECHERCHE ‹#› Nos Expertises Un triptyque d’expertise cohérent pour créer de la valeur avec des données Data science Nous pensons que les entreprises et les acteurs publics devraient bénéficier des connaissances de pointe en apprentissage automatique et en IA pour créer un réel avantage concurrentiel à partir de leurs données. Pour ce faire, nous investissons dans la recherche en informatique, partageons nos connaissances avec des centres de recherche à travers l'Europe et appliquons nos résultats aux données de nos clients. Data engineering Acteurs publics et privés ne sont qu'à quelques pas d'entrer dans l'ère de l'industrialisation de l'IA. Pour relever ce défi technique, nous avons mis en place une équipe d'ingénieurs capables de sélectionner et de mettre en œuvre les dernières technologies et outils pour traduire les opportunités commerciales en une solution technique parfaitement adaptée. Data architecture Les transformations numériques nécessitent de concevoir une infrastructure centrée sur les données pour libérer tout le potentiel des modèles de science des données et maximiser le retour sur les investissements informatiques de l'entreprise. Nos architectes opèrent les changements majeurs de données dans des industries distinctes en concevant des solutions qui tiennent compte des stratégies commerciales et des normes et politiques d'entreprise. question: How is the Positron Emission Tomography (PET) scan used in the diagnosis and monitoring of Follicular Lymphoma?
answer: The Positron Emission Tomography (PET) scan is a 3D non-invasive imaging technique used as a gold standard in the treatment of cancers, including Follicular Lymphoma. It provides precise tumor detection, characterization, and treatment response monitoring. The PET scan is used both for the initial diagnosis and for monitoring the patient's response to treatment throughout the therapy. The data from the PET scan, along with clinical data, plays a crucial role in identifying patients at risk of progression or relapse within 24 months of starting treatment.

question: How are the dimensions of an image represented in terms of channels, height, and width?
answer: In image data, the dimensions are represented in a shape of (channel, height, width). For colored images, there are three channels, one for each color of the RGB representation. The height and width simply refer to the height and width of the image in pixels.

Le RGPD pour une IA éthique Définitions et contexte Définition (succinte) du RGPD Règlement Général sur la Protection des Données Entrée en vigueur le 25 mai 2018. Ensemble de règles européennes visant à renforcer les processus (stockage, traitement, ...) exploitant des données personnelles. Principes fondamentaux : Loyauté du traitement Pertinence des données Durée de conservation Sécurité Nouvelles obligations et nouveaux droits : Droit à la portabilité des données Analyses d’impact Registre des traitements Nouvelles ressources (Délégué à la Protection des Données, DPO) Création d’un groupe de réflexion (G29) pour définir des lignes directrices ‹#› RGPD et Machine Learning Quelques points clés Section 2 : Information et accès aux données à caractère personnel Articles 13 et 14 - Informations à fournir : “finalité du traitement, destinataires, durée de conservation” Articles 15 - Droit d’accès : “l'existence d'une prise de décision automatisée, y compris un profilage, visée à l'article 22, paragraphes 1 et 4, et, au moins en pareils cas, des informations utiles concernant la logique sous-jacente, ainsi que l'importance et les conséquences prévues de ce traitement pour la personne concernée.” Section 4 : Droit d'opposition et prise de décision individuelle automatisée Article 21 - Droit d'opposition : “La personne concernée a le droit de s'opposer à tout moment, pour des raisons tenant à sa situation particulière, à un traitement des données à caractère personnel la concernant fondé sur l'article 6, paragraphe 1, point e) ou f), y compris un profilage fondé sur ces dispositions.” Article 22 - Décision individuelle automatisée, y compris le profilage : “La personne concernée a le droit de ne pas faire l'objet d'une décision fondée exclusivement sur un traitement automatisé, y compris le profilage, produisant des effets juridiques la concernant ou l'affectant de manière significative de façon similaire.” ‹#› RGPD et Machine Learning Ce que dit le G29 (1 / 4) “Articles 13(2) (f) and 14(2) (g) require controllers to provide specific information about automated decision-making, based solely on automated processing, including profiling, that produces legal or similarly significant effects If the controller is making automated decisions as described in Article 22(1), they must: tell the data subject that they are engaging in this type of activity; provide meaningful information about the logic involved; and explain the significance and envisaged consequences of the processing.” “It is good practice to provide the above information whether or not the processing falls within the narrow Article 22(1) definition.” ‹#› From “Guidelines on Automated individual decision-making and Profiling for the purposes of Regulation 2016/679” RGPD et Machine Learning Ce que dit le G29 (2 / 4) “The controller should find simple ways to tell the data subject about the rationale behind, or the criteria relied on in reaching the decision without necessarily always attempting a complex explanation of the algorithms used or disclosure of the full algorithm. The information provided should, however, be meaningful to the data subject.” Pas besoin d’une description sur-détaillée de l’algorithme : explications mathématiques détaillées ≠ manière “concise, transparente, compréhensible” (Article 12), préserver le secret des affaires et la propriété intellectuelle.

Cas B : flux financiers En contrepartie de l’exécution de l’opération visée à l’article X, XXX (débiteur) versera une somme de XXXXX € (en chiffre et en lettre) TTC/HT/net de taxe (indiquez le montant de TVA) à XXX (créancier). Ce versement s’effectuera par virement bancaire, à l’ordre de l’Agent Comptable de l’Université de Lille/Nom du partenaire, 30 jours après émission de la facture, sur le compte bancaire suivant : INSÉRER RIB DU PARTENAIRE s’il reçoit la somme ou utiliser le RIB de l’Université ci-dessous : Le virement devra porter l’intitulé suivant : XXXXXXXXXXX (numéro de facture et/ou le nom du projet). Article 6 : Modification et Résiliation La présente convention pourra être modifiée par voie d’avenant, après consultation et accord des parties signataires. La présente convention pourra être résiliée par chacune des parties signataires sous réserve du respect d’un préavis de deux mois, notifié par écrit et envoyé par lettre recommandée avec accusé de réception. La présente convention pourra également être résiliée de plein droit, sans formalité préalable et sans qu’il soit besoin de recourir à une action en justice, par l’une des parties signataires, en cas d’inexécution des obligations de l’autre partie, après mise en demeure restée sans effet dans un délai de 30 (trente) jours suivant la notification de l'inexécution par lettre recommandée avec accusé de réception. Article 7 : Litiges En cas de difficultés d’interprétation ou d’exécution de la présente convention, les parties s’efforceront de résoudre leur différend à l’amiable, dans un délai de 30 jours suivant la notification écrite de la difficulté. Si les parties ne parviennent pas à résoudre leur différend à l'amiable, tout litige relatif à l'interprétation ou l'exécution de la présente convention sera soumis au Tribunal Administratif de Lille. Article 8 et plus : Clause de confidentialité Clause de propriété intellectuelle Clause d’assurance et responsabilité Clause relatives au RGPD Fait à Lille en double exemplaires. The case of the colon Usually, you don’t need to capitalise after a colon, as in ‘I have one true passion: wombat racing.’ But when the words following the colon form a complete sentence, you are in a different situation, as in ‘Gil has grown a beard for these two reasons: It provides the more delicate parts of the face with a natural shield from. He also likes the way it looks.’ In the same vein, you might have noticed that, for emphasis, writers sometimes capitalise a mid-sentence independent clause or question as in: One of our cardinal rules is, Always ask for feedback. If they become confused at any point, you know where you need to expand or add paragraphs to help your ideas flow more smoothly. You can also try outlining your article to understand its overall structure. Outlining can reveal situations where moving a section of your article can help with the overall flow. Step 3: Read Your Writing for Sentence Flow (Line Editing) At this point, your writing makes logical sense and is organized in a way that makes sense to the reader. But if you zero in on individual paragraphs, you’ll find your sentences are not always arranged in the most sensible order. Sometimes sentences are standing out of order within their paragraph. This happens while we write; human brains don’t work in a linear way, so when we write, we have a tendency to pile like sentences together instead of laying them out one by one. Readers, however, need them organized in a linear way. First A, then B, then C… your paragraph needs to be laid out in a way that makes following these ideas easy for the reader. Look over your writing, and ask yourself: Does each paragraph’s opening sentence logically follow the previous sentence’s closing paragraph?

3.2. For which purposes may an employer carry out this type of monitoring? An employer may carry out video surveillance monitoring in order to protect the interests of both the company and the employees. For example, to protect against robbery, fire and other security issues. The use of video surveillance must be necessary to ensure employees' security, prevention of accidents, protection of real estate and personal property or supervision of the entrances and exits from these places. In every case, video recordings may not record audio.

😀 #mobile_app #happeoAfficher plusapp_2.pngapp_3.pngapp_4.pngapp.png‎Happeo MobileHappeo Mobile – Apps on Google Play Sophie Van DesselpostPublié dans :Company-wide newsLe : 17 avr. 2024, 16:22Search AI beta is here! 🤠 Surfing on the LLM trend, Happeo launched their own search AI, and, as you can guess, we were curious and accepted to be beta testers 🤓 How It Works? Ask questions in the search bar (such as: "what is the guest wifi password"), and the algorithm will pull multiple sources within Happeo to provide you with an answer. By default, Happeo will search through the internal sources, but you can also choose to search through the integrations by clicking “Search from integrations” Where do you come in? If you are an LLM passionate, curious to test it, or just in need of a guest wifi password, shoot all your questions to the model:) From what I already tried, it needs a bit of tuning (where would be the fun otherwise), so if you feel the answer provided by Search AI was incorrect or incomplete, please click on the thumbs-up/down button next to the search result and let them know.

question: What are some potential risks associated with the increased use of AI technology, such as chatGPT, in a workplace setting and how can they be mitigated?
answer: Potential risks associated with the increased use of AI technology, such as chatGPT, in a workplace setting include a possible degradation in the quality of knowledge, the need for a more critical mindset, the importance of properly sharing and transmitting knowledge generated by AI, the potential for decreased interactions between colleagues leading to an over-reliance on AI, and the risk of confidential data leaks. These risks can be mitigated by actively addressing and acknowledging these issues, developing a more critical mindset, implementing guidelines for the use of AI, regularly reviewing and updating these guidelines, fostering communication and collaboration, and ensuring the security of confidential data.

When to override it? ‹#› Data Responsibility Data Quality Data Provenance & Lineage Data Collection, Data Processing, Data Storage, Governance Policies Protection against data breaches & privacy threats Disclosure & Consent Privacy-by- design Data management policies Data ownership & agency Privacy-by- default User Data Rights Privacy ‹#› FRAMEWORK ARCHITECTURE Fairness as an Example ‹#› Framework Architecture Illustrated in the Sub-principle of Fairness Fairness Defined The pursuit of fair AI includes the avoidance of creating or reinforcing unfair bias inherent in the data used to train/ test the models, as well as ensuring diversity in the datasets used and in the teams behind the development and monitoring of the system to ensure equal treatment across groups. Challenges & Risks RISKS Not only discrimination against protected classes, which entails the violation of non-discrimination laws, but also underrepresentation of specific groups resulting in negative reputation and loss of trust. CHALLENGES Failure in detecting bias in a model until after deployment and during operations. (Bias should be mitigated earlier on in the lifecycle) Structured adaptation and redress processes to mitigate, eliminate, minimize bias. Increased consideration for fairness is required in specific use-cases due to the sensitivity of the inputs/ outputs. (AI for loan approvals, preliminary college admissions or CV scanning, predictive policing, systems that use biometric data as input). There are other use-cases that distinguish between individuals in acceptable ways due to the nature of the system and its business objectives: demographic marketing, personalized product recommendations,... ‹#› Components/ Dimensions Fairness components Non-discrimination Outputs of AI are deemed discriminatory if they underrepresent or negatively affect individuals in protected classes Avoid creating/ reinforcing unfair Bias The behavior of AI systems is strongly dependent on the data used to train them. Biased data perpetuates social stereotypes resulting from human prejudice (bias in humans in the design of the system or the processing of the data => how bias is created) or inherent bias in the training data (how bias is reinforced if not spotted and eliminated). Considerations for bias assessment Impact of identified bias is qualifiable, quantifiable Likeliness of occurrence Preventability of bias (technical feasibility + mitigation strategy) Detectability of bias: we provide a list (non-exhaustive) of potential bias sources: Business understanding phase: stakeholder requirements are biased Data acquisition and preparation: Bias in the initial dataset or introduction during the processing Modeling: Model selection accounting for fairness as criterion or bias in the algorithm despite consideration Data: Biased training data or test data or introduction of bias in the data operations and data manipulation. Inaccurate and non-representative data could also result in biased outcomes Data collection devices Data labeling and annotation Data manipulation Deployment Introduced in model tuning Diversity and inclusion Training datasets should be representative of the reality which is culturally and socially diverse. Diversifying the teams working on the design and development of the system is also an enabler of the diversity component in fairness ‹#› Enablers & Best Practices Fairness Enablers Calculation of error-rates and types (e.g., false positives, false negatives) for different sub-populations and assessment of the potential differential impacts. Fairness-aware data mining techniques Fairness metrics Exploratory data analysis Fairness Best Practices Ensure that model training and data operations are not assigned to one person. Assign a diverse team to train the AI and spot potential bias. Diversity in terms of perspective ( enabled by diversity in gender, age, ethnicity,..) As well as technical and functional expertise Use different datasets for training, testing and validation Avoid discriminatory/ unfair impacts by testing the model (comparing model outputs) across different demographic groups to ensure that the model does not learn random patterns from data and address adverse impact. Bias checks: regular control and diligence by the human operator.

A piece of writing with no copyediting, on the other hand, may have a few annoying punctuation errors, yet it might captivate the reader nonetheless. Computers are capable of doing copyediting and proofreading almost entirely by themselves but are useless for developmental and line editing. As a result, this framework focuses mostly on developmental editing and line editing, with some pointers to software tools that can help with copyediting and proofreading. Step 1: Go Over Your Writing for Argumentation (Developmental Editing) All nonfiction writing asserts something, even if that assertion isn’t made explicitly in the article. News writing asserts that the journalist’s interpretation of the facts is the most reasonable one.

Practice 11: Think of some questions you could ask when you arrive at their premise and of some things that you could try and clarify about what really matters to reach a fruitful outcome. Here are some examples of questions you could ask to find this out: “To integrate quickly in your company, what should I be aware of? What are the do’s and don'ts?” “What is the ideal consultant for you?” “To be “at the top” for you, what should and should not be done?” “What have other service providers done that did not satisfy you?” Here are some examples of things you could let them know about your important needs, i.e. the ones that, if they were not met, would lead your work relationship to a point of no return.

You can see it as a review of the course and/or of the coursebook. As examples of things to consider, you might want to discuss some of the following points: what speaking and writing skills you wanted to learn before taking the course and in what ways the course addressed what you wanted to learn, what your usual writing activities are and in what ways the course addressed them, what you learned from the course/how it helps you, how you enjoyed/disliked the course/its content, its style, its layout, its exercises, its length,... what you would suggest to future students taking the course, what you would suggest to the writers of the course. To the degree that people in our lives have been blamed, punished, or urged to feel guilty for not doing what others have requested, the more likely they are to carry this baggage to every subsequent relationship and hear a demand in any request. Hence, we don’t engage in persuasion until we have empathised with what’s preventing the other person from saying yes. A report submitted in fulfillment of the requirements for Course XYZ, Department of XYZ, EURA NOVA. (Example of terms of reference) Summary (Abstract) The summary should briefly describe the content of the report. It should cover the aims of the report, what was found and what, if any, action is called for. Aim for about 1/2 a page in length and avoid detail or discussion; just outline the main points. Remember that the summary is the first thing that is read. It should provide the reader with a clear, helpful overview of the content of the report. Contents (Table of Contents) The contents page should list the different chapters and/or headings together with the page numbers. Your contents page should be presented in such a way that the reader can quickly scan the list of headings and locate a particular part of the report. You may want to number chapter headings and subheadings in addition to providing page references. Whatever numbering system you use, be sure that it is clear and consistent throughout. Introduction The introduction sets the scene for the main body of the report.

Language Powerhouse: Unleashing LLM Potential Context Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as a transformative force in natural language processing. These models, such as GPT-3, LLAMA, MISTRAL and others, have been trained on large amounts of text data, enabling them to accurately generate human-like text. They have impacted many different fields. For example, LLMs can power chatbots in customer service, improve healthcare outcomes by helping to manage and access healthcare information, or even provide productivity help in general by streamlining document analysis and review in a variety of contexts. Developing or customising a Large Language Model tailored to a project’s need is a challenging endeavour. It can incur major costs for development, computational resources, and data acquisition.

Plus d'articles LinkUp Channel Questioning Humour in the WorkplaceI’ve always seen humour as a superpower. Making fun of a lousy situation, sharing a good joke, connecting with people by making them laugh… For a long time, I have been considering these means as powerful social skills. Yet, lately, I witnessed inside Euranova hard feelings after jokes were made or people hurt by some kind of “humour”. And I wondered: what is humour, after all? when should we not make humor? should a company regulate the notion of humour? Because I want to keep a fantastic asset in our culture, while keeping everyone safe with their feelings .Let’s look at the definition of the word: “Form of wit which seeks to emphasize the comic, ridiculous, absurd or unusual nature of certain aspects of reality” (translation from Larousse).
question: How should presenters handle sensitive or unnecessary information in their presentation materials?
answer: Presenters should avoid mentioning sensitive information on slides and remove content from the note section that is not essential for the presentation. This helps maintain focus on the key points and preserves the confidentiality of sensitive information.

Malgrè tout le recrutement de chercheurs “senior”, c’est-à-dire des chercheurs déjà expérimentés et qui ont donc besoin d’une période d’adaptation plus courte, reste difficile. La question de gestion du personnel est d’autant plus pressante que l’un des employés qui devait partir au Canada et qui n’a pu le faire qu’en fin janvier, avait beaucoup travaillé sur l’un des projets en cours. Celui-ci pouvait partir d’un moment à l’autre, or, en raison du calendrier des missions, sa présence était indispensable. De nombreuses fois, le directeur général s’est plaint qu’il fallait au moins trois employés de plus pour être en bon ordre pour les projets à venir. J’ai donc pu constater de la nécessité d’avoir une personne chargée à plein temps du recrutement en France. Toutefois le paradoxe est que même si théoriquement un tel poste serait nécessaire, l’entreprise, de par sa petite structure, ne peut pas encore se permettre de financer un salaire pour un poste qui ne produit pas de bien pour les clients. Cette difficulté de recrutement est renforcée par le fait qu’il n’y a qu’un faible nombre de data scientists dans le monde, ce qui rend ces derniers très attractifs sur le marché du travail.

Talking about savant words like acronyms, initialisms, and abbreviations, do you know what they are and what the punctuation rules are, and, incidentally, how to pronounce them? Phil Jamieson in GrammarPhile Blog puts it all in a nutshell: The term acronym only dates from the 1940s and is derived from the Greek akros, meaning point, and onuma, meaning name. In precise usage, the word acronym refers only to terms based on the initial letters of their various elements and read as single words. Initialism refers to terms read as a series of letters. The umbrella term abbreviation is used for acronyms and initialisms; it also refers to shortened words such as etc. or abbrev.. Thus NATO, pronounced NAY-tow, is an acronym for North Atlantic Treaty Organization, and LASER, pronounced LAY-zer, is an acronym for Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation. FBI (Federal Bureau of Investigation) is an initialism. AIDS is an acronym, while HIV is an initialism. URL, when pronounced as three separate letters, "U-R-L," is an initialism for Uniform Resource Locator, but many people pronounce it as "earl" or even "yurl," making it an acronym. It is a good practice to limit initialisms and acronyms to situations where they add to your message.

Special note on appropriateness As mentioned at the onset of this chapter, recognising feelings is a must, but expressing them in full words and at length is not always necessary. So, when is it useful to express your feelings or to help the other person express their feelings? When is it a waste of time or a risk of being seen as a psychology freak rather than as an efficient professional? In private life, always express feelings. In professional settings, identify when it is taking too much time to reach an action/solution because one of the people involved or more are stuck in their negative emotion. For example, when they are acting from guilt or from fear instead of from enthusiasm and joy, or when there is frustration or anger somewhere in the picture; more importantly, when you feel something is preventing your customer from 'going for it'. ‘I feel … because I need …’ is often the motto in these circumstances.

Ces labels sont créés à partir d’une annotation de régions d’intérêt par des médecins, suivie de l’application d’un threshold (41% du SUVmax de la lésions). La valeur de ce threshold ne fait pas consensus parmi les médecins nucléaires, et peut nuire à la qualité des annotations, et des prédictions du modèle supervisé entraîné sur ces données. Objectif du stage: développement de méthodes weakly/self-supervised et comparaison des ces méthodes à l’approche UNet3D. Les méthodes weakly-/self-supervised sont des modèles qui fonctionnent à partir des régions d’intérêt, et qui permettent donc de s’affranchir de l’étape de seuillage et des biais associés. Cette méthode permet également d’obtenir des contours et utilisant à la fois la PET et la CT, alors que le seuillage se basent uniquement sur la PET. Ces méthodes sont basées sur des techniques Conditional random field. Intérêt pour Euranova: Faire avancer le projet AI4PET (mais la partie segmentation n’est pas le point crucial) Expertise en modèles weakly-supervised pour de la segmentation automatique. Données: données privées AI4PET (mais nécessite un renouvellement du contrat de collaboration).

question: How should a well-written and coherent style be for a piece of content?
answer: A well-written and coherent style for a piece of content should be fun, original, and discreet, while maintaining good English and consistency in the chosen style.

Build a logical path that can be followed by the person with whom you are having the discussion. The most widely-recognised pattern is this one: Introduction (where you set background and purpose) 1st idea / Link / 2nd idea / Link / 3rd idea / link and so on Conclusion (where you restate the purpose and summarise the current communication situation). Transfer learning and generalization could be studied from 3 different angles: 1) Generalization across domains. 2) Generalization across Tasks. 3) Generalization across Concepts which is what has been discussed in this seminar. CHALLENGES Intelligibility of all AI models in the portfolio Non-technical explanations of technical features Technical feasibility of explainability & interpretability is highly dependent on the models used in the system Components determine (with a degree of certainty) Where a model succeeds Where a model fails Where a model results in errors Explainability & interpretability deal with several aspects of the internal workings of AI systems. Understandability of AI-generated predictions understandability of AI-led decision-making: decision-making processes, the determining factors affecting the AI-led decisions, the procedures followed by the algorithm understandability of how AI uses and interprets data Enablers Organizational enablers Refer to the Transparency RACI Matrix. Technical Enablers Surrogate Models: “A global surrogate model is an interpretable model that is trained to approximate the predictions of a black box model. We can draw conclusions about the black box model by interpreting the surrogate model” Partial dependence plots (PDP or PD Plot) Global variable importance/ interaction Sensitivity analysis Counterfactual explanations Self-explaining and attention-based systems Local-interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations (LIME): to explain the contributing factors driving model outputs SHapely Additive exPlanation (SHAP): to explain the effect of particular features on model decisions Leave one Covariate Out (LOCO) Counterfactual explanations Partial dependence Individual conditional expectation (ICE) =>It is possible to use one/ a combination of these techniques to improve model explainability Interpretability techniques Input feature importance ranking Local classification boundary approximation Saliency Maps for computer-vision applications Best Practices Organizational best practices Explainability plan for how decisions will be explained to users and decision-subjects. For models that were pre-trained and acquired: does the system provider offer (continuous?) assistance and support for explaining how the model functions. Explainability is considered in the evaluation phase as criterion for model selection An impact assessment on the AI-powered decisions should be carried out. The higher the impact of the decision, the more intelligibility is needed. Explanations to end-users and individuals/ groups affected by the outcomes of your system upon contestability or request should not be provided in technical jargon and detail. not only text communications for explanation but also visual representations (user-friendly videos) or a combination of different methods Counterfactuals to explain how your algorithms function and how the model arrived at predictions/ decisions Technical best practices Develop built-in automated explanations for decisions System features that allow filtering and access to accurate information for informed decision-making Training methods and decision criteria can be understood for human operator challenge and validation Transparency Sub-principle 2: Auditability Challenges & Risks RISKS Failing to assign the appropriate controls for auditability readiness and ensuring legal processes for the audits opens the system up for accidental/ unwarranted manipulation. CHALLENGES High dependency on explainability and interpretability: Auditability must be possible for auditors with varying levels of technical expertise.

The aims and objectives of the report should be explained in detail. Any problems or limitations in the scope of the report should be identified, and a description of research methods, the parameters of the research and any necessary background history should be included. In some reports, particularly in science subjects, separate headings for Methods and Results are used prior to the main body (Discussion) of the report as described below. Methods Information under this heading may include: a list of equipment used; explanations of procedures followed; relevant information on materials used, including sources of materials and details of any necessary preparation; reference to any problems encountered and subsequent changes in procedure. Results This section should include a summary of the results of the investigation or experiment together with any necessary diagrams, graphs or tables of gathered data that support your results. Present your results in a logical order without comment.

As mentioned in Section 3.2, MUPPET follows a structure based on defined bases for each object. When implementing a new version of an object, a new class is created, inheriting from the object’s base. Having a base proves highly beneficial for organizing new implementations around a convention and for implementing shared code that is common to all variations of an object. Another crucial 17 structural aspect of projects like MUPPET is the extensive use of Git. Git serves as the ultimate tool for collaborative work on the same projects.

question: What are some common topics discussed in a team meeting at the beginning of the week in a project setting?
answer: In a team meeting at the beginning of the week in a project setting, common topics discussed may include problems and successes encountered in previous projects, particularly in areas such as techniques and client relations. Other topics may include team dynamics, recruitment, and commercial matters.

Well, let’s get rid of this frustration! @Nicolas Posocco explains: “We are experimenting with a new workshop format to study efficiently a tech we know very little about: the WorkOneShop (I know… the name is bad… suggestions are welcome!). In short, 3 people are locked together in a room for 3 hours, with a dice… When they enter the room, they know pretty much nothing about the tech they are going to explore, but when they leave the room, they are able to confidently answer the question “In which context is this tech relevant to solve a problem?”. How is such magic possible, you may ask? Well, the workshop takes advantage of parallelized search phases around the tech, and of pooling phases, when each participant pitches to the 2 others his/her findings. It may become one of our main Knowledge Management tools for efficient Tech Watch. We have already led such workshops around simpy, a python library to build simulations, which study was motivated by the needs of the Reinforcement Learning team as well as a digital twin project in TME, optuna, another python library which can be useful to standardise hyperparameter search in all machine learning projects, and a last one around a more general question: ”How to make an LLM reliably generate structured answers?”, which led to the production of a comparative table of available solutions. We have a potential backlog of candidate techs/questions here, and you can read the notes/see who you can ask a coffee break with around the topics studied.” Interested to step in?

The word refers to the circumstances or situation prevailing at a particular time or underlying a particular event. In our last scene example, you could now say: “As my wife and I already mentioned before, your dogs bark constantly when you are away.” So, now your communication act has people with defined roles and a starting point. You can now define where you wish to be heading together. State the common goal Set what you see as a common objective for this particular act of communication and the path to get there. In our noisy neighbour story, you could go on to say: “We need to find a solution that is viable for you, for us, and for the dogs. Can we speak together to see how to get there?” This is a general principle valid for introductions in all communication acts, spoken or written, short or long. Going further, just know that introductions often need to be longer than in our case above, as for example when you write a report, or an essay, or a dissertation, or when you moderate a debate, etc.

The number of forward passes needed by Opti-CAM is determined by the number of iterations in the optimization process, a value defined by the user during the creation of the Opti-CAM Explainer object. In the case of Score-CAM, a forward pass is required for each channel coming out of the last convolutional layer of the model. For instance, taking the VGGNet16 model as an example, Score-CAM requires a total of 512 forward passes, while Opti-CAM achieves very satisfying results with only 200 forward passes. This corroborates what is said in [8]. Another advantage of using Opti-CAM is that the time complexity can be controlled by adjusting the length of the optimization process. However, reducing the number of optimization steps will have a negative impact on the quality of the result.

TELEPHONE 2.1. What are the rules for recording telephone conversations? Both the Telecommunications Code 2016 (available only in French here) and the Data Protection Law are silent regarding the recording of telephone conversations. According to Article 6 of the Data Protection Law, processing of personal data means the automatic processing as well as manual processing of personal data carried out by an individual or a legal entity aiming in particular to gather, record, store, organise, modify, exploit, use, expedite, distribute, diffuse, destroy or consult personal data as well as any operation related to the exploitation of personal data, indices, directories, data files or interconnection.

For clarity, many writers hyphenate prefixes ending in a vowel when the root word begins with the same letter. Example: ultra-ambitious Semi-invalid However, in recognition of the modern trend toward spare hyphenation, do not hyphenate after pre and re prefixes when the root word begins with e. Rule 4. Hyphenate all words beginning with the prefixes self-, ex- (i.e., former), and all-. Examples: self-assured ex-mayor all-knowing Rule 5. Use a hyphen with the prefix re when omitting the hyphen would cause confusion with another word. Examples: Will she recover from her illness? I have re-covered the sofa twice. Omitting the hyphen would cause confusion with recover. I must re-press the shirt. Omitting the hyphen would cause confusion with repress. The stamps have been reissued. A hyphen after re- is not needed because there is no confusion with another word. Rule 6. Writers often hyphenate prefixes when they feel a word might be distracting or confusing without the hyphen. Examples: de-ice With no hyphen we get deice, which might stump readers. co-worker With no hyphen we get coworker, which could be distracting because it starts with cow. Hyphens with Suffixes A suffix (y, er, ism, able, etc.) is a letter or set of letters that follows a root word.

Using all the altered images {Ak|∀k} generated during perturbation, it computes, for each k, the model’s prediction on the kth altered image y′k = f(Ak). The y′kvalues are normalized using a Softmax unit (Appendix 7.2.3), and the final attribution score is simply its Ipredth value. The attribution score ak = Sof tmax(y′k)Ipred is then stored in the associated kth premise memory. Essentially, the higher the prediction score for the class of interest on the altered image, the better the attribution score will be. To illustrate with the example of the cat image, if an altered image of the Egyptian cat (fig.11) receives a high prediction score in the ”egyptian cat” class, the mask used to alter the image will receive a high attribution score. Conversely, if the ”egyptian cat” class receives a low prediction score, the associated mask will get a poor attribution score. question: What is the difference between explicit and tacit knowledge?
answer: Explicit knowledge can be easily articulated, codified, stocked, and accessed. It can be expressed in a formal and systematic language and shared in the form of data, scientific formulas, specifications, manuals, etc. On the other hand, tacit knowledge is more difficult to articulate and transfer, as it is often based on personal experiences, mental models, and intuition.

The editing stage concerns language only. After that stage come two more: (1) copy-editing, which includes formatting, typesetting etc, and (2) proofreading, which is the very last stage to spot and take out all the remaining errors. Without getting too technical and just FYI, there is an overlap and a confusion over the term 'copy-editor'. Sometimes it refers to the action of improving the text, which requires linguistic skills, sometimes it refers to the action of laying it out, which requires the skills of a graphic designer. In this book, 'editing' refers to the language and communication skills only and 'copy-editing' refers to laying out and graphics only. If a passage is unclear or an assertion seems questionable, the copy editor may ask the writer to clarify it.

question: What is an example of a common mistake that a service provider might make regarding assumptions about their prospects' knowledge or wants?
answer: A common mistake that a service provider might make is to assume that their prospects already know something about what they can do or want something from the provider, without actually confirming it.

The database is a cache of a subset of the log. ‹#› The Cat enter in the Schrodinger's box Transaction log The DB DATA & TABLE DUALITY TWO ASPECTS OF THE SAME REALITY This is possible today with the modern distributed Stream Processors allowing STATEFUL PROCESSING (Required for Continuous query and maintaining Dynamic tables). Arasu and al., STREAM: The Stanford Data Stream Management System. 2004 ‹#› On change of state can also trigger actions A change is a notification Experiment DB Transaction log Count Cat DB The Cat enter in the Schrodinger's box From a same change of state we can Write in a change log From this log derive different tables (to structure this information in different ways) Notify services to trigger actions ‹#› New ranges of applications Stateful Stream processing µ-service 1 µ-service 2 µ-service 3 CEP EVENT Collector Stream Analytic app Statefull Stream Processing µ-service A typical EDA Services are State-machine based, stream analytics or stateful stream processing service The data integration between services is made through kappa architecture & CQRS for materialized derived view Scalable architecture, works for batch &/or RT ‹#› Taxonomy of µ-services New ranges of applications µ-service CEP State-machine Based Stream-based (Topology) RT Analytics Stateful Stream µ-service ‹#› Taxonomy of notifications for a µ-service A change is a notification ‹#› Now we can look at the data exchange patterns Is the database that really matter These patterns can also be used for integrating the Data Organisation In the next slides we present the data communication patterns. The good news is that those patterns can be applied on Service Database updates AND Data Organisation updates The second claim is important because that means that we can leverage the data update notification pattern implemented at the Data layer in the Service Architecture ‹#› DATA & SERVICES INTEGRATION SOA (or µ-services architecture) versus Data architecture API Gateway SOA ESB DATA EDW DATA LAKE DATA LAB ‹#› Now we can look at the data exchange patterns Is the database that really matter #1 EVENT TO DB #2 DB TO EVENT #3 DB TO DB (1 TO 1) #4 DB TO VIEWS (1 TO *) #5 EVENT ENRICHMENT We present these patterns independently but they can be composed together. ‹#› Event to DB pattern DATA COMMUNICATION PATTERN #1 Starts with A service starts sending transient notification. Listener to change The DB has a listener to the notification event type. The DB is update by a client library according to the notification. The service logic always read in DB as usual. As soon as the new value is written in the DB the service can read it. ‹#› DB to Event pattern DATA COMMUNICATION PATTERN #2 Starts with A service (the master for this data) writes in DB. A client library (can be a software client lib or CDC) sends a data update event notification.

To address this issue, the features are up-scaled from (14, 14) to match the size of the original image (224, 224) using the bilinear interpolation process. While this process falls outside the primary focus of this report, a brief description is provided in Appendix 7.2.2. Figure 10 offers a visual representation of a feature before and after up-scaling. Figure 10: VGGNet16[11]’s last convolutional layer feature before and after up-scaling with bilinear interpolation. Since the features are already normalised between 0 and 1, once they are upscaled they can directly be used as a mask. Score-CAM falls into the parallel approach methods (fig.4), it uses in parallel multiple premises. Each of the premise is used at exploration to store one of the up-scaled feature, that we can now call mask. The code of the Explorer object implemented during my internship is provided in Appendix 7.1.2. Perturbation Score-CAM applies mask to the image in the simplest way. To generate the altered image, it computes a pixel-wise multiplication of the example image and mask. This operation is done on all premises, to go over all masks generated during exploration (eq. 1). ∀i, Ai = x × Mi (1) Where: • Aiis the ith altered image • x is the example image • Miis the ith mask If we consider (c, h, w) the size of x with c the channel dimension size, h the height and w the width of the image. Then, all masks generated at exploration are of size (1, h, w). To compute the pixel-wise 13 multiplication, the mask is automatically broadcasted to the size of the image. This means that the mask is repeated c times along its first dimension, making it (c, h, w) shaped. Figure 11 gives a representation of the perturbation step.

La technicienne, quelle que soit sa spécialité, dispose d'un savoir-faire général très appréciable au sein d'une entreprise. C'est pourquoi environ 300 000 postes sont déployés tous les ans dans les secteurs de la technique et de la maintenance. La formation académique d'une technicienne varie selon le degré de qualification de celle-ci. Les techniciennes expérimentées sont qualifiées de « techniciennes supérieures ». Elles sont généralement titulaires soit d'un brevet technicien supérieur (BTS), d'un diplôme universitaire de technologie (DUT) ou d'une licence professionnelle. De nombreux bacs professionnels (bac pro) permettent l'accès à cette profession. Ils offrent cependant au jeune diplômé des chances d'évolution plus réduites que pour les détenteurs d'un BTS ou d'un DUT. Au cours du cursus, il peut être pertinent de favoriser les formations en apprentissage, puisque 80 % des apprentis sont recrutés après l'obtention de leur diplôme.

Writing the report: the essential stages All reports need to be clear, concise and well-structured. The key to writing an effective report is to allocate time for planning and preparation. With careful planning, the writing of a report will be made much easier. The essential stages of successful report writing are described below. Consider how long each stage is likely to take and divide the time before the deadline between the different stages. Be sure to leave time for final proofreading and checking. Stage One: Understanding the report brief This first stage is the most important. You need to be confident that you understand the purpose of your report as described in your report brief or instructions. Consider who the report is for and why it is being written. Stage Two: Gathering and selecting information Once you are clear about the purpose of your report, you need to begin to gather relevant information. Your information may come from a variety of sources, but how much information you will need will depend on how much detail is required in the report. You may want to begin by reading relevant literature to widen your understanding of the topic or issue before you go on to look at other forms of information such as questionnaires, surveys etc. As you read and gather information you need to assess its relevance to your report and select accordingly. Stage Three: Organising your material Once you have gathered information you need to decide what will be included and in what sequence it should be presented. Begin by grouping together points that are related.

Vendre la DG comme réduction du time to market n'est pas top : Tu ne vends pas de valeur mais la réduction de coûts + cette réduction peut se traduire par se séparer du personnel non nécessaire. C'est bien dans une optique réduction de coût mais moins bien dans une optique création de valeur. La DG est un enabler/catalyseur (facilitateur) de valeur : Les business cases qui drivent la valeur utilisent des données, par définition, peu ou pas accessibles. La DG permet d'alimenter plus efficacement les business case, nous donne la clé pour déverrouiller l'usage des données en accord avec les législations qui réglementent leurs usages, nous permet de lier la valeur générée par un biz case aux données (tout le narratif autour de data value management) Pas besoin de convaincre que ça marche, c'est une nécessité à la transformation digitale et l'exploitation de la donnée dans une chaîne de valeur ! 3 axes stratégiques Revenu : augmenter la productivité Cost : optimiser les procédés internes, réduire la maintenance Innovation : s’engager sur des nouveaux marchés La DG est un catalyseur pour la création de valeur. Cette dernière est alors pilotée par les données !

question: What steps should be taken within 48 hours to report a sick leave and provide proof of illness in a system called Boond Manager?
answer: Within 48 hours, you should encode your sick leave on Boond Manager, specifying that it is a 'sick leave Tunisia'. Additionally, you need to attach a medical certificate in Boond that details the nature of the illness and its probable duration. Failing to produce the medical certificate in time may result in not being granted sick leave.

Well, let’s get rid of this frustration! @Nicolas Posocco explains: “We are experimenting with a new workshop format to study efficiently a tech we know very little about: the WorkOneShop (I know… the name is bad… suggestions are welcome!). In short, 3 people are locked together in a room for 3 hours, with a dice… When they enter the room, they know pretty much nothing about the tech they are going to explore, but when they leave the room, they are able to confidently answer the question “In which context is this tech relevant to solve a problem?”. How is such magic possible, you may ask? Well, the workshop takes advantage of parallelized search phases around the tech, and of pooling phases, when each participant pitches to the 2 others his/her findings. It may become one of our main Knowledge Management tools for efficient Tech Watch. We have already led such workshops around simpy, a python library to build simulations, which study was motivated by the needs of the Reinforcement Learning team as well as a digital twin project in TME, optuna, another python library which can be useful to standardise hyperparameter search in all machine learning projects, and a last one around a more general question: ”How to make an LLM reliably generate structured answers?”, which led to the production of a comparative table of available solutions. We have a potential backlog of candidate techs/questions here, and you can read the notes/see who you can ask a coffee break with around the topics studied.” Interested to step in?
